result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:16 pm - Defendant Cyrus L. Spaeth in court.  Attorney James Patrick McLinden in court for Cyrus L. Spaeth.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.

Information to be filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 08-22-22 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 07-18-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Cyrus L. Spaeth
Current: 705 S. 16th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 06-09-2022)
Prior: 1224 S. 36th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220

$250.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond. 
--Nickolas Spaeth, 705 S. 16th Street, Manitowoc, WI  54220.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 2 cts. felony bail jumping, possess THC, possess fentanyl, and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-13-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $250.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.
